vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
ἐάν
(so early Attic Inscrr., as [Refs 4th c.BC+], also contraction ἤν and ἄν, see at {ἤν},{ἄν} (B) [ᾱ], which by crasis with καί become κἄν:—if haply, if, regularly followed by subjunctive: for its use and for examples, see at {εἰ} [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II in Hellenistic and late Greek, ={ἄν} after relative Pronouns and Conjunctions, as ὃς ἐάν whosoever, [LXX+5th c.BC+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: if (usually used in general conditions or conditions that imply some doubt)
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
if (usually used in general conditions or conditions that imply some doubt)
if, ἐὰν μή, except, unless; also equivalent to ἀλλά, Gal. 2:16. Ἐάν, in NT as in the later Greek, is substituted for ἄν after relative words, Mt. 5:19. Tends to be an indicator for the subjunctive mood.
vocabInfos._es_Definition: si ; aun si, aunque ; cuando ; a veces usada como partícula que indica contingencia en ciertas construcciones (MAT.5:19) ; a menos que
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:

3) ean + 3261 me , 除非
